subject: Re: [junit] Categories in JUnit 4.8
msgSnippet: ... Well, TestNG has been using string groups for more than five years now and nobody has complained, so I don t think it s really failing.  I don t even
messageBody:
On Wed, Dec 9, 2009 at 11:51 PM, baardl <bard.lind@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hi.
>
> My take on using strings as markers are that this will faile over time.
>
Well, TestNG has been using string groups for more than five years now and
nobody has complained, so I don't think it's really failing. I don't even
remember anyone suggesting to use statically typed groups either (if ever),
so there doesn't seem to really be a problem there.

I think both approaches are fine. I went with strings with TestNG because I
thought that being able to specify regular expressions at run time ("run all
the tests that belong to the group "fast.*") was appealing.

--
***Cédric
*
